triples.name: Matthews correlation coefficient
triples.relevance: Core metric being evaluated and compared to other evaluation measures for binary classification.

triples.name: Balanced accuracy
triples.relevance: Alternative metric compared to MCC that normalizes true positive and true negative predictions by class size.

triples.name: Confusion matrix
triples.relevance: Fundamental framework containing true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives used for evaluating binary classifiers.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: Harmonic mean of precision and recall used as a comparison metric against MCC in binary classification evaluation.

triples.name: Binary classification
triples.relevance: The primary task domain being evaluated, involving classification into one of two categories.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The discipline in which binary classification evaluation metrics are applied and studied.

triples.name: Statistics
triples.relevance: The scientific foundation for statistical indicators and evaluation measures in classification tasks.

triples.name: Accuracy
triples.relevance: Baseline metric for classification performance that is compared to MCC and shown to be less reliable for imbalanced datasets.

triples.name: Youden's J statistic
triples.relevance: Alternative metric equivalent to informedness (sensitivity + specificity - 1) used in binary classifier evaluation.
